Reviews.Title: “Just what you need”
Reviews.Author: WorldWideWob
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel was good value, comfortable and had a good bar. The service could have been a bit quicker, most times there seemed to be nobody around. Problem when I arrived gave me a free upgrade of room. I have stayed here 3 times in total now and I would reccomend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed, good price and central location”
Reviews.Author: Hannah G
Reviews.Content: This hotel does what it says on the tin. It was my daughter's first trip to London and we had a full schedule so wanted to stay centrally but not pay through the nose for the privilege. We booked this as part of a Theatre deal and very happy with the price. I had booked a twin but in fact we ended up with a triple which provided us with more room and somewhere to store our luggage. The location is actually quite peaceful, we were at the back of the hotel and the room was quiet and we slept well. Shower room was very clean with storage. Breakfast was perfect for fuelling our day of sightseeing and walking although I would say that the breakfast room itself is quite pokey and characterless. All in all it filled our requirements without frills.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to treat your guests!!”
Reviews.Author: Denise G
Reviews.Content: It was my daughter's 40th birthday, I booked this hotel as very central. Most things satisfactory, until on the last night, when we returned to our room, my daughter noticed some of her personal belongings had been tampered with and certain items, we believed, taken!! We took all the correct and necessary steps with a view to reporting this as soon as possible. Later the matter required to be elevated, I was given the Manager's personal mobile phone number by the company that "umbrellas Days Inn West" and at first he appeared to listen, however, it appeared as the matter became more serious, he became more verbally abusive and even threatened me with legal action on behalf of the cleaning company they use. However upon contacting the cleaning company, they informed me they did not know anything about the situation and therefore denied all knowledge of 'taking legal action against me'. I informed the Manager he was a bully and acting in a totally inappropriate manner. Unfortunately the language and mannerism that was displayed at this point, I found very frightening. I WOULD NEVER, NEVER visit this hotel again, apart from receptionist Phil all other staff were not very pleasant at all.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok.”
Reviews.Author: Rob10065
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good position near Pimlico Underground Station and bus stops. The area is very tranquil. The hotel and our room were clean and in good condition. The room (#110) was pretty small, with a cupboard, no drawers, a desk mostly occupied by the tv set (no flat screen), and a round coffee table that just occupy the little space available. The bathroom was tiny with no shelves where you can put your toiletries. Wi-fi is available, but it's not free. There is one public desktop computer in the lobby, and it has a coin-operated timer (£3/hr). Continental and English breakfasts are ok and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Just about ok”
Reviews.Author: vasterne
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel, at Â£120 a night, as we were attending a posh do and didn`t want to be too far away and thus incur a costly taxi ride. Room was pokey, really a single with a double bed, the small wardrobe and lack of drawers bears this out. Bathroom had cracked floor tiles with some of the grouting between them missing. The shower screen was off its runners and the underside of the toilet seat was peeling off! There were no tissues in the holder and when I asked for some to be put in while we were out we were told that "Housekeeping had gone home until the morning!" What would have happened if someone had been sick on the reception area floor? Leave it till morning I suppose. I asked our room cleaner in the morning for some tissues but was told the hotel didn`t have any tissues! We went downstairs intending to have a drink but found the bar was closed for refurbishment, not that there was any sign of this. We ordered a taxi for 7.15 but this never turned up so we had to hail a black cab to avoid being late. Room has french doors out onto a balcony. Door catch could easily be forced and balcony is shared with 2 other rooms and only low walls separate it from 100 yards of other balconies!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Swing a Cat”
Reviews.Author: S F
Reviews.Content: Business trip room 154. Will not be visiting again. Yes the company rate was very good but that was where it finished. Entered room leaving bag in the corridor, then moved room furniture so I could get my bag into the room. No space whatsoever, Harry Potter had more room under the stairs. If ever a room warranted a flat screen television this was one. The size of the room was a total joke. There was no remote control for the television and the hotel could not supply one, however you could change the channel with your big toe from the bed. The whole room was very dated, the sink was cracked, and just about on the wall. I don't even what to discuss the space regarding the toilet but you get more room in a portaloo. Plastic spoons that melted when making a cup of tea, okay they were Tetley tea bags. Thatâ€™s something I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet location, stayed for one night and no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: Airliebeach2009
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the days inn westminster. Found it on laterooms and for the price (Â£79) suited us just fine. Our room (101) had a nice view of the street, close to reception but wasnt too noisy. The room size was reasonable and more then adequate for our one night stay. Tea and coffee facilities were fine. Bed was comfy with clean sheets. Bathroom area was ok too unlike other reviews I have read. The pride of pimlico pub just a 250yd walk was nice for a couple of beers. All in all, i would say this hotel in our experience was great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean but small”
Reviews.Author: Amanda1051
Reviews.Content: Great location, very near Pimlico station. Very small room but clean and tidy, tea and coffee facilities, clean, modern bathroom, although very small. Not the best view of a brick wall but we weren't too bothered about that, it was fine for somewhere to sleep. Didn't really need to interact with the staff apart from booking in which was done efficiently. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “It was average, good and bad points”
Reviews.Author: orientfan16
Reviews.Content: Arrived into London, needed a hotel to stay in central London. Found this hotel on Laterooms for Â£69. As it was a Days Inn I thought it would be good, as I have stayed at Days Inn before. Arrived at hotel, very easy to find. Only 5 mins walk from Pimlico underground station. First impressions were good - The street was quiet and tidy, and outside the hotel looked fine. The reception was also clean. Checked in, took them 15 minutes as my booking was quite late. I noted the rack rate was advertised at Â£125 per night. The room was 106 on the ground floor, a 5 seconds walk from reception. The room was clean, but small. There was a burnt mark on the floor caused by the iron, but the room itself seemed ok. The bed was comfortable, the TV worked properly, and the bathroom was functional although small. The shower though was very powerful, that possibly was the best thing about the room. The view from the room.... well look out the window and you would see a brick wall!! Literally there is a half a meter gap and then a solid brick wall, so no view at all. I guess you could say it is a mini patio, although it did make the room hot. Days inn did provide items such as toothbrush and toothpaste for free, and the shower gel/shampoo provided seemed quality stuff. We slept fine, did not hear any noises from other guests or staff, and no traffic could be heard. I noticed the hotel advertises on the internet a bar, room service and a restaurant but it actually has none of them at all. So would I stay here again? If I could not find a better hotel for a good value price then maybe, I would not pay above Â£70 for it though. Im not sure if this is a Days Inn any more though, the room had no Days Inn brochure/adverts, and except for the sign above the door and an invoice with the brand name you would not guess its a Days inn. The staff on reception seemed ok, not rude at all and were polite. The items in the vending machines were good value, but overall I have to say considering the price paid this hotel was average.

Reviews.Title: “V Hot Room, and rude kitchen staff!”
Reviews.Author: cleopatra92
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 2 nights at this hotel, as a birthday treat for me and a break for my pregnant daughter. We wanted something v local so my daughter did not have too far to walk, I thought the location was perfect for Oxford Street and The West End. We booked through London Theatre Break, and being August there wasn't much choice and it was not v cheap. Our room was tiny and shabby but would have been fine for 2 days, except it was boiling hot, We had the window wide open, so then it was noisy, but the second night we realised that the heating was on full blast, and I could not adjust it, so by the morning we both had bad headaches! The manager was apologetic for that, but we had unexceptable behavior from the kitchen staff, telling us off for coming to breakfast at 9.40am. Breakfast was billed to serve until 10am. We were not having a full English, so it does not take long to eat a piece of toast and have bowl of cereal, especially after being awake most of the night with the heat. I love the area, but would not chose that hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room.”
Reviews.Author: jj1965
Reviews.Content: Good location. However a bit dissappointed with rooms, as they were not as shown on website. The room was clean but very very small.

Reviews.Title: “good location if nothing else!”
Reviews.Author: macca4551
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on trip to London for weekend break. Good location close to Houses of Parliament and London Eye. However a bit dissappointed with rooms, as they were not as shown on website.Very tired and dated in need of modernisation . would we stay here again? no ! Would look for something more modern and value for money. Breakfast was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great triple room”
Reviews.Author: millie516
Reviews.Content: We were in london for a few days in May, I have never been so i was searching for a hotel, not toooo expensive and a great location. WELL I FOUND IT!!! it was within walking distance of everywhere it was reasonable priced and it was a triple room which was surprising spacious. So if you are ever in London this is definately the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: ddavechloe
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife got an invite to the Queens garden party on the 19/07/11 and was booked into the Days inn Westminster stayed in room 552 on the 5th floor when we booked in at reception we were not informed that the lift only went up to the 3rd floor!!! with a ig case i was not to happy. the room was ok but that's it the toilet sat had a chip out of it the light on the wall did not work when you went to the toilet the sink was in the way breakfast in the basement was 7/10 having said all that we had a great day at Buckingham palace

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: MartinPerryab
Reviews.Content: A very ordinary London Hotel. My sister in law and I stayed (Â£99 per room) - my room much bigger than hers. I slept well she was awake early with airplanes overhead. Torn carpet inside door (nice carpet otherwise). Boring DIY breakfast make your tea, toast etc etc. Cooked breakfast Â£4 looked ok - ish boring sausages, bacon ok, scrambled egg overdone, hash browns and baked beans - again all help yourself. Service? - well there wasn't any apart from cleaning tables! OK adequate but Â£99 I expect something a bit better - maybe it would have been Â£99 for 2 in each room in which case excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update”
Reviews.Author: chrischick
Reviews.Content: Excellent location though noisy at night. The room was small with a tiny en suite shower. The whole place feels tired and needs redecorating with new, fresh soft furnishings etc and the en suite needs to be modernised.

Reviews.Title: “ONLY STAY HERE IF YOU WANT TO PAY TWICE”
Reviews.Author: RayFerries
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel 01/06/11-03/06/11. Upon checking in, we provided our debit card and were told that the total for the stay would be "pre-authorised" until we checked out. On 05/06/11 we noticed that our account was significantly "lighter", and on investigation, it transpired that the hotel had debited the Â£240 total for our stay, and the "pre-authorised" figure (the same amount) was still being held. I called the hotel on 05/06/11 to request this sum be released, as it can take up to a week otherwise, and was curtly told "it takes 72 hours, you just have to wait". I adivsed the lady on reception that this was not acceptable and I needed to speak to somebody that could rectify the situation. Eventually I was transferred to the accounts department (who, evidently, was dealing with a similar complaint for another customer) and the gentleman there (Assad) said he would look into it "in the next hour or so". 2 hours later I called back, only to be informed that Assad had gone home, but had left a note (where was my phone call?!) stating that he had called someone else and had been told that they had only debited one amount. Again, I had to explain that yes, only one sum had been debited, but an additional sum was being held. The gentleman I spoke to on this occassion (Prentin) could not have been more unhelpful if he had tried. When I stated that we had not been told that the money would be held, and that we would have happily paid for the stay upfront rather than go through the inconvenience and stress of having our money rendered inaccessible. His response was "well, you could have paid with a different card"... this would not have helped, as the pre-authorised amount would still be held. As we were at a stalemate, I asked for the contact details for Head Office and was given a number to call. I spoke to another gentleman (Steven) who seemed sympathetic and gave the impression that this practice was incorrect. Steven advised that he was escalating my complaint and would get somebody to call me. By lunchtime on 06/07/11 I had not heard anything, so called and spoke to Steven again, who said he would chase the complaint (though, this time, he definitely seemed less interested in my problem). This morning (07/07/11) I called Head Office again and was advised that the person Steven probably emailed was off sick, and my complaint would be passed to somebody else. I received a phonecall back from a lady (whose name I did not take) who advised that this hotel had left the group at the end of last month, but she would ask for the owner to call me. I have received no further phonecalls and we are still waiting for the money to be released. This really is not good enough- as I said earlier, we would happily have paid for the room in advance, rather than have to deal with this. I have spent over an hour on the phone and have had to borrow money from friends as this was to be our money for the week. I cannot express how upsetting this whole ordeal has been, and at the moment I have absolutely zero faith that the hotel will do anything to help the situation- I suspect that the money will just be released as it usually would anyway. With regards to our actual stay- the communal areas of the hotel are extremely rundown, room was small but clean, but was absolutely boiling. We were on the top floor and it's like a furnace up there. The weather this weekend was fairly warm, but not hot- it was much cooler outside than in our oven of a room! The lift was pretty terrifying too. We are used to staying somewhere a bit more central so this felt very out of the way. Reception staff on check in seemed helpful, but when we called down to ask for them to book a taxi, they basically said no! You can get better value for money elsewhere, so please do! I'm still witing for my phonecall, but won't be holding my breath...

Reviews.Title: “At least the lift is working now”
Reviews.Author: Chris1612
Reviews.Content: Reasonable hotel.....good location. Friendly helpful staff try to make up for its shortcomings. Namely, luke-warm breakfasts every day and no digital tv. They obviously dont want to spend any more money on customer comforts.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mona31
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. v adequate rooms and continental breakfast basic but grand. location very good and staff pleasant. only drawback was that lift was out of order (on the day we arrived and still that way 3 days later) which was a big deal as one of our party had a heart condition. will return definately

Reviews.Title: “Only for super fit clients”
Reviews.Author: Theologyprof
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of a terrace and has five floors accessed through narrow steep staircases. The day I stayed the elevator was out of service and the receptionist said it had been broken for some time. If I'd had any luggage or was unfit it would have been exhausting to get up all the stairs. A good property spoiled by lack of a working elevator.

Reviews.Title: “A good base not too far form the center of London”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFanFromFlroida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not too far a walk from Victoria station but with luggage seemed a little longer! I would have gotten a cab the next time. We didn't have breakfast at this location but it was available. We found a little launderette nearby to do laundry. The 24 bus was just steps away and super handy getting into London. The front desk staff were always polite and helpful. One note about the noise level in our room. We discovered the window was open slightly but even then, after a day of activities, didn't have any problems sleeping. We shut the window and it made a difference. Our room was spacious and the bath was quite nice. Room was equipped with iron, hair dryer and tea pot which was handy. For the price we felt it was a good option in London. We would stay here again. (maybe not the week of the Chelsea flower show though.) We had a family event to attend so we had to find a place. The area felt safe and convenient which in a big city is a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Awful !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wedgem
Reviews.Content: No Restraunt or Bar as advertised, No Sat TV as advertised., no double glasing to windows, very noisey, Bathroom dirty, Breakfast Coffee Machine not working correctly...grennerally awful...avoid!!

Reviews.Title: “No frills but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cathy_n_phan
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked in at the last minute to stay here. It has all you can ask from a inn. Decent size room, big bathroom, information about stuff to do in London, friendly and helpful staff. You have to pay for the internet but that's normal in London. It's a few minute walk from the closest station and there were plenty of good places to eat out at.

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed!”
Reviews.Author: HarleyD883
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this location. No security or tagging of items offered when leaving luggage with reception, presented with a key to a small cupboard off reception area, in which other guests had left prior luggage. Any person staying could have easily removed another guestsâ€™ luggage. Rooms small, corridors looked past their best, with in areas, thread worn carpet, and cracks in walls. Lack of wall sockets for room kettle. Breakfast-definitely not fresh croissants, and the full English look unappealing with dried scrambled egg, and over heated beans, all obviously having been left for too long under the heat lamps. Location not so good, with little to do around area other than local theatres.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with hotel or experience there”
Reviews.Author: butterflyMalta
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small and if you've come from abroad it's not big enought for the suitcases. The lift takes a long time to arrive as there's only one lift and continuosly goes up and down until the doors close. I had breakfast included in the price I paid for the room however when I got there the staff said it was continental which consists of bread, cheese and cereals. There's a sign advising that if you've forgotten anything the hotel will be happy to provide with blades, sewing kit, toothbrush, toothpaste however when I asked for a needle and thread they didn't have.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Tomby1
Reviews.Content: I decided to book a room with daysinn westminster due to the competitive price and close proximity to pimlico tube station. I was pleasantly suprised with the hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the room was spacious and comfortable and the bathroom was a much higher quality than expected. The bed was comfy and the room was clean. I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for good value for money in the pimlico area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: butterball4219
Reviews.Content: Good at the price for a nice part of town, Victoria station a short walk away and the West End not much further. We have paid more for a mediocre B/B in mid Wales. Big room on the top floor, clean, comfortable and with very helpful staff a most pleasant stay. Continental breakfast is pretty basic but again for under Â£70 quite adequate. Would definitely recommend this for anyone wanting a short stay in London

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rate...”
Reviews.Author: wleasure
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. On the same strip with a Budget Inn and a few others. Easy walk from Pimlico tube station and plenty of shops, pubs, cafes. Woul recommend to friends and stay again. Be sure sign up for their mailing list and book through their website for the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “knock down rate . irritating faults. broadly ok”
Reviews.Author: finbar
Reviews.Content: got a superb rate ( one third of rack rate) for a 1 week stay just before Xmas- so churlish to complain. Location is OK - closer to Pimlico than Victoria. My single room was clean and fresh. Bed a bit hard, but nothing awful. Very miserly with the milk for tea and coffee and told me on my last day they had run out. of UHT milk !?. small thing but a rattly sash window woke me up constantly every night . they should really fix it my room was single glazed and frot facing so it was a bit noisy all in all, it was OK.buit as usual a couple of small touches would have made a big difference

Reviews.Title: “Could be better - Some reviews bit misleading”
Reviews.Author: Lodewyk
Reviews.Content: Okay, could be better maintained and cleaned. Continental breakfast if not exciting, English breakfast is Â£8 for bacon, scrambled egg and vienna. Would not go back. Rooms cold, out of fashion, old.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: diya03
Reviews.Content: Ok place to stay. The room was cold 'in the freeze' as the electric heating was finding it difficult to heat the room up. The hotel was otherwise reasonable to sleep and get away to work during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Fine as a base”
Reviews.Author: Gayle32
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal through hotels direct - Â£80 a night B&B which was a lot better than the Â£125pn on their own site. Rooms were clean, I think we were lucky compared to some of the other reviews. 5 mins walk from Pimlico tube station & 10/15 mins from Victoria. As we on a sight seeing trip & going to the o2 we spent hardly any time at the hotel but I would recommend this as a base. Breakfast isnt fantastic but it was substantial.

Reviews.Title: “Not many reasons to stay here...”
Reviews.Author: MarkCheshire
Reviews.Content: ... but it has a good location, it was clean enough and - that's about it. It is in need of refurbishment, the rooms are generally small, the bathrooms smaller. The staff are OK but seemed a bit disinterested. Even if you are on a tight budget, I would advise you to spend a little more and get somewhere that feels better to be in.

Reviews.Title: “Alright, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Fish_in_a_Blue_Bag
Reviews.Content: A friend booked this place for a night out in London. Checked in ok to our family room, room had three single beds (good), small but clean bathroom (good) and minimal mod cons (ok). Had quite a good nights kip after we rolled in at 4am - in hindsight concierge was very friendly considering we weren't probably too coherent, so extra marks for service. Location was good too, quite near Pimlico tube. Issue? Â£140 for a night! Even for London, this was too much. I've stayed in MUCH nicer places in Central London for this money. My advice: ok place which is functional, not great with much better value for money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disgracefully Pitiful!”
Reviews.Author: DavidS88
Reviews.Content: If you have money to burn and need to stay in a Dungeon - then this is the place for you! If not, give this place a wide berth...!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't rush back”
Reviews.Author: davibyrne
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff okay, breakfast not nice at all! Room okay. Hotel needs cleaning. This place really could do with a sprucing up. Seems like someone has taken there eye off the ball a bit. Not the worst place in the world but definitly missing the mark on a lot of things

Reviews.Title: “sticky carpet, tiny room, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Camacuk
Reviews.Content: we stayed fro 2 nights. room was tiny! about 7sq m room + 3.5 sq m bathroom thus one person always had to sit on the bed whilst the other one got dressed. Breakfast was VERY poor! But there's a very nice little cafe with free wifi around the corner - fairtrade coffee and amazing croissants, salads, baguettes, etc... the area is nice. hotel location is fine. Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: ihatelongflights
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite far from the airport and main train stations - about 30 pounds, so be prepared for that when you arrive (unless you're arriving at Victoria station which is less than a 5 minute walk). The hop on/hop off busses pick up from Victoria Station so that was great beause those were our modes of transportation while we were travelling and catching them was very convenient. You have to pay for internet access or you can use the computer in the front lobby for a small fee. The room was basic (bathroom was quite nice) but comfortable and great for what we needed it for. We didn't actually pay for the hotel, we redeemed Wyndham rewards points (FYI if you redeem 15,000 points in Canada you'll get a 3 star/$100 a night hotel, you can also use them for internation hotels though so we used those same 15,000 points and got a twin room which is regular over 200 pounds - obviously a much better deal than redeeming them for a Canadian hotel room) so the value was great. It is along a road that can be loud at times but shutting the window solves that problem and unless you're a super sensitive sleeper I don't see that really being a problem for you. The staff were wonderful (arranged private cars for us on numerous occasions) and the rooms were thoroughly cleaned each day. I would stay here again and would recommend it for others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cgergely
Reviews.Content: Great location-easy to get to the London underground tube stations- Pimlico and Victoria stations both and easy walk. Close to major sightseeing, pubs and shopping. Rooms adequate, clean, and staff helpful. Would deffinitely stay here again on a return visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place to stay for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: Acegirl
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in London due to ash and they were good enough not to take advantage of us. We were able to book two adjacent rooms for a reasonable rate. The rooms were small and basic, but that was really all we needed. The bathroom was clean and the shower hot. We found the beds and linens to be a bit tired, but we had a quiet sleep. The hallways and elevators are a little cramped and difficult to move through with copious luggage. Its a 10 minute walk to the underground. We didn't get a chance to explore the area, but there seemed to be some restaurants and pubs around. Not a luxury hotel by any stretch, but passable.

Reviews.Title: “Its ok for 1 Night!!!”
Reviews.Author: britgirl16_uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel and service was great but the rooms are very small.....just room for 1 Double Bed and thats it really. Everything was clean and breakfast was great, apart from you needed to pay an extra Â£4 per person to upgrade to Full English which they don't tell you when booking!!! We decided to eat out one Evening at the Mexican down the road and this was fantastic for us but there is an Indian and plenty of Pubs nearby. The only let down was our room was near a main road and did get quite noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and well located"”
Reviews.Author: gr_ke_ol_ma
Reviews.Content: Family room on top floor was clean, comfortable and quiet but without the air conditioning quite hot and stuffy on hot summer days (low 30's). Had to pay 10 pounds extra for use of air conditioner - bizarre. The hotel was clean and staff helpful. Breakfast room in basement was light and airy. Continental breakfast was basic but satisfactory. "Real" coffee would have been good. Location was great - about 1 kilometer easy walk to Victoria Station and a couple of kms to Westminster and London Eye. Great base for exploring London. The hotel and surrounds provided a good first experience of London and travelling for my teenage daughters.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN AND COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: drummondstornoway
Reviews.Content: A nice clean hotel in a nice part of London and not too far from any attractions. Rooms small but comfortable and clean. Resteraunt not open for evening meals when we were there but all the same not bad.

Reviews.Title: “incredibly small rooms and heat was unbearable”
Reviews.Author: reviewer168
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated, but the rooms were incredibly small - the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in! The heat was unbearable and I noted that another reviewer had the same poblem. The window had to be open a bit to help, which it didn't much and this led to a poor night's sleep due to the traffic noise, which was a surprise as the road didn't seem that busy during the day. Staff were helpful, but be careful when you pay for Breakfast in the price as this only included the continuental breakfast, with the cooked breakfast costing an extra Â£4 each, which to be fair they did warn us about once we approached the table and started adding the bacon... Overall, I enjoyed my stay in London, but need to catch up on my sleep now and feel much happier in the cooler environment of my own home. I will definitely be choosing alternative accommodation when I go back to London later in the year!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TourismProfessional
Reviews.Content: Good location (get off the tube at Pimlico). Near Pimlico for places to eat. Overall Hotel good. Small rooms but that is usual for London. Well decorated. Good shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: HorsemanIowa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 3 children ages 26, 21 and 15. Close to Tube and bus stop for sightseeing or getting around town. Rooms small but okay. Had a double and a triple room. Beds were not real comfortable and could stand to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a trip to the Capital!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel1956
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a night at this hotel and apart from the room and bathroom being a bit on the small side, I would give it 9/10. It's a great location, only just over 5 min walk to Victoria Station. It is in a very nice area- my daughter and I felt safe, even walking back from the tube at 12.45. It was also very quiet for central London. The staff very pleasant and helpful, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KFinz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 17 to 21. Had to stay an extra day due to ash cloud. Staff helped us with getting extra room and when we thought we could leave one of the staff helped us get a private car to take us to the airport. Really great of him. Though we did have to cancel it the next night due to the fact that our flight got cancelled. Hotel is close to the Pimlico underground station. Took that to get to main attractions. Had some great little restaurants near by. We had a triple room which had enough space for 3 of us girls. One of the beds did have a vibration due to the cooling system that was not fixed during our stay. But otherwise hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night - if you can cope with the smallest bathroom in London”
Reviews.Author: ianjmorley
Reviews.Content: For one night this hotel is fine. Although the rooms are small they are very clean and the beds are ok. The bathroom (well actually a shower room) was tiny - you were either in it or not and you could not turn around nor dry yourself. The shower was suprisingly good however. Rooms have 14 inch portable tvs on a stand high up on the wall - with limited channels its a bit of a letdown. The same can be said for breakfast - I paid an extra Â£4 for hot foot but wish I hadn't as the food quality was very poor (those really cheap sausages/fattty bacon/diluted fruit juice etc).......

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel, ideal for exploring”
Reviews.Author: ALTGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Days Inn Westminster for 3 nights as a base for a short break exploring London. We got a good deal on Superbreaks.com. Hotel is ideal as a base while in London - it's about a 10 minute walk from Pimlico tube station and a 15 minute walk from Victora bus/tube station. Location was brilliant because of this! Hotel is on a lovely street in Westminster, easy to find, and rooms were small but clean. Continental breakfast was included in our price and was the usual - toast, cereal etc. Overall the hotel was perfect for what we wanted - we really only slept there as we were so busy in London. It's not a luxury hotel by any means so if you're looking for somewhere to spent a large portion of time then it's probably not for you. That said, we only had two (minor) complaints: an absolutely filthy roller blind in the bathroom, and a fairly unfriendly night time receptionist. I'd definately return!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You See - No More, No Less”
Reviews.Author: Terry W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with spouse. The Hotel is typically Days Inn - very few frills but you know that before booking - or should! Room was quite small for a Double, but as we were only using the Hotel for sleeping and breakfast this didn't worry us. The Bar is only open from 1800-2100 and not at all on Sundays - slightly odd. There was a restaurant it said, but not sure as we went out to dinner both nights. There is an Italian and an Indian restaurant within three minutes walk, Breakfast was Continental or Full English - we paid for Full English and it was hot and a reasonable choice. It said there was air conditioning in some rooms - we didn't have it but that was no great problem for Aoril but could be a serious omission in high summer. The whole place was spotlessly clean - I've not been in a hotel so clean before! There was no "Service" as such but the staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. We booked three weeks in advance and I specified a Smoking Room - on arrival was told all smoking rooms were occupied - my only real complaint. Perking is FREE in the road outside the hotel after 1830 weekdays and all weekend and Bank Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Daysinn Westminster Hotel SW1V 2BJ”
Reviews.Author: gilltm
Reviews.Content: I went to london few weeks back where i stayed at Hotel Daysinn I was given room on top floor with a view of London eye and big ben I found staff very cooperative and efficient facilities like internet was free the most admireable thing was the location of the hotel with bus No 24 which was all night bus one can see all the major sight seeing attractions In case of any problem efficient staff of the hotel was ready for help breakfast timings(0630 to 1000) were long enough for having it even after late night out :-) I hadnt had any problem in staying there all my trips of sightseeing attractions to visiting windsor stone henge bath etc were arranged by the staff on my one phone call on my way back to heathrow my transp[ortation was arranged by the staff on very reasonable rates what else one is looking for??? My stay at London was made pleasent by the days inn staff I was given full information on my arrival about travelling in london like travelling cards etc then booking tickets to sightseeing attractions like madame tussauds etc were pre booked which made me to avois the long queus I really had a wonderfull stay there and it wouldnt be that great if I wouldnt have stayed in Daysinn westminster I would strongly recommend if you are going to london for the first time thats the place and the best people to stay with even if you are planning your last visit to London I would highly recommend to stay there to have nice memmories :-)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, compact”
Reviews.Author: Psychosquirrelgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel near Victoria. It is walking distance from Victoria, but much closer to Pimlico station, which is just around the corner. The area feels very safe, even at night and with young children in tow. This is a very small hotel - that cannot be denied. But the rooms sizes seem to vary. I stayed as part of a school trip, and whereas my daughter and I had a very tiny twin room, our friends down the hall had a much larger room. For all its teensyness, though, the room was very well equipped with tea and coffee making facilities, an iron and ironing board, plenty of storage space, a TV, phone - everything you need from a budget hotel. And it was spotlessly clean for the whole of our 3-night stay. I work as a self-catering manager and so am very particular about these things. I even pulled out the beds! And not a speck of dust in sight. The bathroom was tiny, also, but with a heavenly strong shower and tons of hot water. Our room was right over the front door and had a patio window with access to a balcony. My bed was right against this window, but I still slept wonderfully every night. There was noise, traffic and people noise, but that is to be expected in London. That's all part of city life and not worth complaining about. My bed was so comfortable I hated leaving it in the mornings! We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful - absolutley no complaints. The continental breakfast was very fresh, always stocked up, and dishes cleared away quickly. All in all, I have no complaints about this hotel. It is a cheap hotel in the middle of London, and a safe and clean place to stay. What more do you need? I do not understand the bad reviews some people have left on this site. They were obviously expecting 5 star service from a budget chain, which is ridiculous. You get exactly what you pay for. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: blackharrington
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a 2 for 1 deal from a national newspaper. This made our stay, fantastic value......... We had upgraded to a 'Deluxe' room for an extra Â£10 per night, and found it to be excellent in all departments (size, cleanliness, etc). Location is great, tube within 3 minutes walk, bus stop within 30 seconds (this bus route will take you into the heart of theatre land and operates 24 hours a day), plenty local brasserie's (try 'Grumbles'), and pubs. Those who like a good walk, Westminster palace is 30 mins away and Buck house is about the same, whilst soho can be reahed within an hours gentle stroll. The only downside was the cooked breakfast, very cheap produce, cooked to death. But what can you expect for Â£7 on central London! We will be going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Receptionist was threatening us :-/”
Reviews.Author: dkfl888
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a value for money: a hotel with good location and good amenities, yet at affordable price. According to their website Days Inn seemed to be exactly what I needed - a better offer than those of regular bed'n'breakfast options. The website promised neat modern spacious rooms, clean refurbished bathroom, a classic English breakfast, and an overall cozy atmosphere. In reality everything turned completely different from what we expected from these over-promising statements. When we arrived, the receptionist could not find our booking (that i made online) in his records, and i had to unpack my luggage at the reception to prove that i had a reservation. Moreover, after the booking was confirmed, it turned out that the needed room was unavailable. We wanted a twin room, and instead were given a double bedroom. The most outrageous fact is that he didn't apologies, but started to argue that I did not mention this request while booking the room online. In fact, there was no even this option (to choose from either one or the other room type) on their website, which implies that on arrival the hotel should offer an option to choose from. This is an ordinary procedure that any hotel should stick to. After this horrible check-in, we got a "double" room, which was not even close to double, and rather nearly enough for one person. And it smelled awful! All these things were accompanied with a rude and extremely impolite service, as the receptionist was shouting while we tried to solve the room availability issue, blaming that "I sneaked around" to check his words. Although he was not the manager of the hotel (it was happening after midnight, and the manager was at home), he tried to threaten me saying that he can turn us out without giving any room at all. The second room was located in the basement, and it was very noisy with vibrating floor because of the working generator (which was somewhere close to our room). The "classic English breakfast" consisted of scrambled eggs made of powder, and dry not fresh sausages. I never ever faced such a horrible service before, and I'm sure there are no hotels worse than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great staff, Great Price, Great Hotel - hightly reccomend”
Reviews.Author: CraighSolihull
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel in convient location for the tate galeery, plimico tube near by , Victoria 10mins walk. Geat room, clean and good size.. great breakfast, pleanty of choice..I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, very clean Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Pyra25
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and were given a room with two single beds at first. After we noticed that, I went back to the receptionist and was quickly given a great room on the top-floor with lots of space, a double and a single bed, and a very nice bathroom. We tried the breakfast and were surprised: For 4 pounds you have a nice variety of cereal, jam, cheese and some fresh fruit (continental). The croissants were delicious! Very good value. Service was always very friendly and the location of the hotel is very good as well: About 4 minutes to the next subway which takes you everywhere in central London in about 5-10 minutes. Would come again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for London”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirl010
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay, given room on top floor. Convenient location. Continental breakfast good and in pleasant surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “good location but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: corsie
Reviews.Content: have stayed here a few times on business due to proximity to office. Good for public transport links and lots of good places to eat closeby. Also in decent area which seems safe for female travellers. However the hotel itself is very basic. Small rooms which can be noisy on the front and too hot depending on location. Problems with water in top floor rooms - either cold or not running at all. Service very indifferent both at reception and in the bar/restaurant. Cannot believe the rate is Â£125 (!) per night when you could get a travel inn/lodge for a whole lot less. Dont stay here unless you have to.

Reviews.Title: “OH MY LORD, NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: visitandrate
Reviews.Content: First- we got moved here from their ''sister hotel'' across the street (best western). Second- because we got transfered by another hotel you would think that they would be nice..NOPE! Third- NO A/C, and when i asked if we could have a room with A/C, the lady at the counter looked at me and said ''Sir, this is LONDON, we dont have A/C''. Fourth- and the worst, they have the world's non-safe elevator in which we got stuck in and recieved no APPLOGIES, DO NOT RECOMMEND

Reviews.Title: “Ok but don't expect too much.”
Reviews.Author: Morelos
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel for one night by my work. It was in a basement room which was near the kitchen, so it was very warm. The room was rather tatty, the shower was old, leaking and I was unable to get the water go above luke warm. One the plus side the room was big, the staff were helpful and the location near a tube, restaurants and within walking distance from the Houses of Parliament. The area felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: Williammc01
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on two night visit to London for 1st anniversary. They placed us on ground floor next to a fire door. Had to keep the curtains drawn all the time as there were people waiting for buses outside the window and road and pedestrian noise was severe. You couldn't sleep with the banging fire door, noise from the entrance lobby and folk running up and down the corridor noisily. This was a delux room apparently, but didn't have a bath in the very small en suite. The bed was small and uncomfortable and there was little space around the bed. There was a sign in the bathroom stating that if you have forgotten something like a toothbrush or a razor contact the receptionist and they would provide it with their complements. Asked for a razor and was directed to a vending machine with no razors. Tried to buy a snack and it kept the money after making a little noise. This was the worst place I have ever stayed. To cap it all when I contacted customer services on return they promised to get back to me. Well guess what that never happened. Location is great but was glad to be checking out

Reviews.Title: “poor hotel - avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: Didsburysmancs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Days hotels in different locations, but this one is a big disappointment. Room very small - which is okay for one night - but with no television, not one that works anyway. When reported to reception that TV does not work, did send someone to look at it but who did not know how it functioned or how to fix it. And that was that. One good thing I can say is that it is clean - which is very important. But otherwise a substandard hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not worth the Â£125 rate”
Reviews.Author: jonandmarkuk
Reviews.Content: I managed to book a room at the hotel for only Â£51. The staff were friendly and the hotel very clean. Location wise it's a few minutes walk from Pimlico Tube Station and Tate Britain, but not much else around in the area so for eating out and such you may need to get the tube. At Â£51 our room for the night was good value, however if I had paid the Â£125 rate advertised at reception I would not have been happy. The room was very small and one side of the double bed was next to the window / radiator (pleased the radiator was off or it could burn). If you are looking at paying over Â£100 for a room in this hotel I do suggest you look somewhere else, you really can get 4 star hotels with huge rooms (in comparison) for not much more sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GreatPlaces2see
Reviews.Content: Five females traveling together, two were teenagers. We requested 1 double or twin room and 1 triple room. The triple room was very spacious and the double room was very, very small - the teens stayed in it. The location is excellent, walking distance to the "tube" and bus runs out front. Near Buckingham Palace and Victoria Station . It was very clean. I would stay there again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: alduncan
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit small and poky, with one of the sides of the double bed against a wall. Having said that, they'd used the space very efficiently, it was very clean, tidy, the bed very comfy and the bathroom immaculate, with a great power shower. Perfectly adequate for a night or two (if your from a country where your more space you may find it cramped, but in London space is at a premium!), and a convenent location. Do search around for a good price- direct at the Days Inn site was overpriced (Â£115), but searching on travelsupermarket.com we got a good deal (around Â£80) with 1800hotels.com. Budget in another Â£4 per person if you want to upgrade to full cooked breakfast (like us greedy-gutses!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel chain!”
Reviews.Author: robin96
Reviews.Content: For a decent hotel group (have also stayed in the Shoreditch Days Inn) great value for money and really friendly staff. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: chanEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night. The staff were polite, professional, smartly dressed and very helpful and foreign staff spoke good english, better then some english chavs. Room was clean with kettle and tea coffee facilites,iron and board, + hair drier. We paid Â£6.99 each for buffet breakfast which include cooked english breakfast, tea coffee, fruit juice, yogurt, toasts, crossiants and rolls! Eat n drink as much as you want!! Room was small but then you only go there to sleep so that was no problem. We stored our luggage before we got the room keys and afterwards as well which was added advantage. We will certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A Step Too Far”
Reviews.Author: EssexCoupleUk
Reviews.Content: Well 98 steps actually. That was the number of stairs climbed to get to our room as the lift was out of order for the whole week end (Friday afternoon until Sunday morning). I would be interested to know how long it had been out of order. The room was small but OK clean and nicely decorated, but very hot as it was at the very top of the hotel. There was an air flow unit above the bed but no remote with which to operate it. When we asked at reception for a remote control we were told it would cost an additional Â£10 to use the unit. Which in the end desperate for a good nights sleep we agreed to pay. Sadly no offer to waive the charge for the air con in compensation for the lack of the lift, this would have been a nice gesture. The water in the shower ran cold after only a minute, I did complete one of their maintenace cards placed in the rooms but received no feed back. So beware read all of the conditions relating to your booking. Our booking was a package deal. On the web page it shows the 'restaurant' with nicely laid tables, with cloths and cutlery, on entering the 'restaurant' down yet more stairs in the basement, the tables were formica topped and you had to help your-self to cutlery. The continental breakfast was included in the package, and a sorrier continental breakfast I have not seen in a very long time. Mini croissants, continental rolls, cereal, some yogurts, preserves oh (nearly forgot) delightful pre-packaged processed cheese, I think of the cheddar variety! That was it, no nice cold meats. The coffee (tasted like instant) was from a machine also dispensing tea and all other hot drinks and there was some orange juice and possibly grapefruit juice as well. But all was not lost you could have an upgrade to a full English for the additional sum of Â£4. Location was ok just a short walk to Pimlico tube station. Wouldn't suggest any-one stays here - well not at the top anyway!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you look for cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: danworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovated on Belgrave Road among the cheap hotels and "B&B's. The location is not bad, about 10-15 minutes walk to victoria station. Bus stops right in front of hotel. The hotel itself is very basic. Rooms are tiny - two adults with their luggage can NOT fit. We had to move our suitcases all the time between the floor and the bed just to move around. Rooms are not dirty, but do not give you a feeling of freshness and spotless clean. The linnens and pillow were smelly (I had to spray my pillow with my aftershave). The mattress is very old, creeky and hard. The breakfast is OK, but a BAD value for the amount they charged for it. Staff was OK, neither good or bad. By nad large they were friendly enough, but not necessarily helpful. For the price we paid, it's good value, if you accept all the above as givens in a cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could say I've stayed at worse”
Reviews.Author: Winsford_9
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry but from my point of view this is a terrible hotel, granted we arrived late on the Sunday night around 11pm, but checking in was an event in itself. Then Igot to the room, a bit smelly like yesterdays breakfast, I had to wipe the shower clean before I used it. It was also really noisy. But it is cheap for London and the breakfast was okay. I did notice as well that they didn't use the room I stayed in on the professional hotel photos. I wonder why? Beware though if you like a pint the bar closes at 10pm!!

Reviews.Title: “My suggestion: find another place”
Reviews.Author: lacruiser
Reviews.Content: I really can't believe this hotel got so many high ratings here, that is one of the reasons we selected it. Our suitcases were searched while we were out, and a cheap trinket was stolen. Absolutely, use the hotel safe for valuables. The desk clerk really didn't care much when I told her. The bottom sheet was badly torn, a big chunk completely missing! the hole was about 12" x 12", amazing they would put that on the bed. The bed sucked. No other way to put it. Just a terrible mattress. Small room, maybe 10feet by 10 feet. The staff are very friendly, but they actually know nothing of the neighborhood! It's amazing, first the desk clerk marked the wrong place on the map (the one they give to you for free) where the hotel is located, couldn't answer any questions about London, and didn't know the currency (absolutely true). Next day, another clerk, when asked if there's a good Italian restaurant around, assured me there was not, but said to walk down 2 blocks and turn right, there's lots of other good restaurants. Well, on the way, ONE block down on the same street (Belgrave), and VISIBLE from the front of the hotel, is O Sole Mio, an Italian restaurant, and it was great. The location is just so-so, most of the desireable London attractions are not nearby, so you need to take bus/tube to get to them, or be prepared to do some walking. I've been to London four times, stayed in 5 different hotels, this was by far the worst experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good base. Especially for first timers to London”
Reviews.Author: craig_traveler
Reviews.Content: Days Inn Westminster is a good base for central London, especially those visiting fot the firs time and wanting to be in close proximity to most sights. The hotel itself gets the job done, with standard European style small rooms, but with most modcons, including wifi at a cost. As I was staying on a pricline bid, I didn;t use the restaurant or other conveniences, bur was satisfied enough with a comfortable bed, ensuite bath, small desk, and small tv. As mentioned the hotel is between Vistoria and Pimlico tube stations. There's a Cafe Nerro around the corner thats opewn until 10pm, and a pub up the street.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC!!”
Reviews.Author: dippiddeedood
Reviews.Content: The room is small, the bathroom is small... but it's clean and comfortable and the staff are friendly and obliging. If you are planning on staying in your room all day, don't stay there, but it you are there to explore London, then this is the place. It's so conveniently located to EVERYTHING! A bus stops almost outside the door. There are two tube stations at your disposal. Pubs, restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores all within walking distance. In fact, everything is within walking distance if you care to really sightsee! I would definitely recommend to all those who are ready to explore all that London has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Cosy Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: receptionist2000
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online as we wanted something near to victoria coach/bus terminals. Its exactly 10 mins walk from Victoria Bus Station and 3 mins walk to nearest underground station Pimlico. The hotel is located on Belgrave Road, a beautiful Georgian Terraced street, its a clean quiet area, with alot of hotels, we definately thought it was the most attractive hotel on the street. Check In was quick & efficient, Staff were very friendly & helpful. Our twin room was spotlessly clean , very warm & comfortable, rooms are quite small but are sufficient, bathroom was immaculate. Breakfast was served every morning and its a buffet style/ serve yourself idea. Continental breakfast was included in our rate, and guests can upgrade to the 'full English' cooked breakfast for only Â£4 extra per day!!! The full english breakfast looked very tasty although we didnt take it, and preferred the more healthy option. Dinner was available in the evenings from 6.00pm, the dinner menu looked very reasonable with a great choice of foods. There is a lovely Italian restaurant ' Pizza Express' just around the corner from the hotel about 2 mins walk, and also a nice indian restaurant nextdoor to Pizza Express. We stayed for 4 nights in June 09, the only bad part of our trip was the weather!! It wasnt awful , but I had hoped for more sun & heat, I had to wear coats/trousers the whole time, -no shorts/t shirts.... For me the best part of the trip was the great location of this hotel, so close to the tube station, and only 2 stops away from Oxford Street for shopping. I couldnt have asked for a better Hotel & would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: chem_j
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid (Â£35), I couldn't ask for better. Location is great - 5 minutes from Pimlico tube and 10-15mins walk from Victoria. Located in a quiet residential area in a road with lots of other hotels and B&Bs. As a single female, I felt perfectly safe returning around midnight. The room and bathroom are small, but as the hotel is located in a terrace of old houses, you can't expect anything else. If you are looking for large rooms, go to a hotel built for the purpose. Breakfast is fine - toast/cereal/croissants/yoghurt/cheese with tea/coffee/hot chocolate from a machine. Also scrambled egss/bacon/sausages/beans/hash browns for full breakfast. Check in/out was fast enough, and staff were pleasant. Rooms were quiet. There was good tourist information in the rooms. The only quibble I would have would be the lack of security in the luggage room. You were given a key and left unaccompanied in the room, so anyone could interfere with other bags.

Reviews.Title: “Broom Cupboard with en-suite shower”
Reviews.Author: TwinkletoesDublin
Reviews.Content: Just back from two nights here with my daughter. Booked twin room but, despite my protests, was given a "double" with bed pushed against wall, necessitating a climb over one another to get to the bathroom. Room was TINY-and cold- with a miniscule en-suite shower-room. Carpets were stained. Restaurant was ghastly: This morning the only transparent window was blocked by discarded soiled mattresses. Stomach-churning.

Reviews.Title: “Just an Inn”
Reviews.Author: billsinc
Reviews.Content: Getting a good value hotel in London is very difficult, and I guess this is an average Â£100 a night hotel. On the good side the room was spotlessesly clean, Continental Breakfast was good. The view from room 553 was good. The bad side: - Air conditioning, well not quite. There is a cooling unit in the room overwhch you have no control. Room size pretty small. Showering, not easy trying to stand in a dormer to shower. Can hear noise from the street. Worst of all the fire alarm went off at about 7.00am- - thankfully it was a false one, shame everyone seemed to have time to get dressed before rushing out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maver1ck
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Days Inn Westminster for 2 nights last week. The hotel is located very conviently near Victoria Station ( about a 10 min walk) in a beautiful area of Westminster on Belgrave Rd. Reception and staff at the hotel were very friendly. We got a very cheap deal and that reflected in the room we were given. The room was tiny in the basement with the window opening onto a tiny courtyard where smells from the kitchen wafted through. It didn't really matter to us as we were just sleeping there and in fairness the beds were very comfy. Because natural lighting in the room was poor, all lights had to be turned on to make it look somewhat daytime. Other than that I would recommend the hotel. Reception staff very friendly. Free newspapers in reception everyday and they were very helpful with tourist attractions that are nearby ( Buckingham Palace, St James Park about 15 mins walk) So if its a cheap deal you've got.. be weary of the room you get! Some are tiny! But overall a great weekend and would definitely stay at the Days Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in room 106”
Reviews.Author: andvalOrmskirk
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in room 106 unless you want to be woken up a 5.30 a.m. by the very loud noise of the kitchen extractor fan followed by the powerful smell of breakfasts being cooked. we did not sleep a wink after 5.30 & our clothes smelt of cooking the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: vtgian
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days (27/2 - 2/3) and we are very happy with this hotel. Our check in and check out were very fast and the reception personel were all polite during our stay. We were given the room 360, which was a double room (not deluxe) and i must say it was larger than expected. Spotless clean both room and bathwoom. Hot water availiable whenever needed, still the fixed shower maybe a bit uncomfortable. And i would appreciated it if there was brush for the toilet. Amenities included hairdryer, ironing, showercap, nail care, liquid shoap for hair and body and shoe polisher but no tea facilities The room was a bit cold for me but maybe it was because i was sleeping near the window. Using the extra blanket made it fine. I don't know if the hotel was full booked but we didn't hear a sound all night long. Still our room was not located on the street side. When it comes to location, the hotel is near Pimlico Underground - blue line (3-5min walk) and bus station is almost outside the hotel entrance. Victoria is just a little longer but has tube, train and bus. So you can go everywhere in minimun time. Eating is not a problem as there are many coffee shops and pubs around. For breakfast try Cafe Mignon on Wariwick Str, english breakfast less than 6 pounds, really cozy and friendly. We would stay again at Days Inn especially when we paid less than 70pounds/night.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: carrkr
Reviews.Content: Ive read a few reviews about this hotel and honestly dont know what some people expect from some places ?? I think this hotel was good for a number of reasons ... Price, Location and Excellent Transport Links. We booked this Early November and got 2 nights for Â£109... when we got there it was Â£140 a night ?? The hotel is located in Pimlico, which is a small district in Westminster. We flew to London Heathrow from Glasgow and getting to The City couldnt be easier. We got 2 Weekend Rail Tickets (Â£21 each) and this gave you access to both underground and the buses. The underground train (Picadilly Line) takes about 45 mins to Green Park Station and then its the Victoria Line to Pimlico and its round the corner from there. The hotel let us into our room at 12.45pm although we werent meant to get in until 2pm so that was a bonus as we got to drop our bags and head out. The room was on the small side as was the bathroom but its a base for sleeping ?? We had a double bedded room and it comes with hairdrier and trouser press is you need that sort of thing. The Bathroom had a large Shower cubicle but again not much room to move when two are in there. I couldnt comment on the Food served at the hotel as we never ate there but the staff were friendly and pleasant enough. The underground station is a 2-3 min walk away and the hotel is also served by the No.24 bus which stops directly outside the hotel. You couldnt ask for more !! Travelling time into the city is about 10 mins on the bus and roughly the same on the Underground given that you have to change trains a few times. Overall i would give the hotel a 8/10 for the Price Location and Excellent Transport Links. If i were to return to London then I would definetly book up for here again !!.

Reviews.Title: “Even for London - Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Balding_Bon_Viveur
Reviews.Content: Taking my wife and mum-in-law to see a show in London, provided an opportunity to stay there the night, and having stayed relatively trouble free at Days Inns previously I thought I would give this a whirl. You expect a `standard' approach from chain hotels, which can be disappointing in terms of a `genuine' experience, but I'm a brit, so it didnt really matter. The hotel though was a huge let down. The hotel seemed in a good location, and in practice the surrounding area is rather nice, the common areas were clean, and the hotel pretty well furnished. So the negatives.. I called the hotel to ask about parking - because the website wasnt clear, and should have picked up at that point the key problem here - the staff. The girl on reception had a poor standard of English, and effectively couldnt wait to get me off the phone when I started asking about nearby parking options. Apparently there was a meter outside - cheers for that, other than this I was met with very long silences, I gave up and went to try and find one on the web. On arriving at about 1.40pm, the girl on reception told us our room wouldnt be ready until after 2 - we looked around to survey at least one other couple waiting - did we really have to wait for 20 minutes?... I suspect a tad more investigation might have found our room ready, she didnt even offer me the opportunity to check in, so you can gauge she hadnt even checked the reservation, 0/10 so far. We were given the key to the luggage room, the girl utterly oblivious to a 3 hour drive to the hotel, and 20 minute walk in the cold to the hotel from where we parked the car. Did I mention parking was an issue! Â£45 for 29 Hours at the nearest NCP. If you're driving, avoid this hotel. So, we come back, get to our room, sold as a family room, to sleep three adults. It was tiny, for the money we were paying. We went downstairs and asked if the hotel could get a cab for us, we were simply told we'd be better off trying our luck on Belgrave Road outside reception that if they ordered it would be a 15 minute wait, again bad attitude from the girl on reception. The night porter was worse when we got back. The machine swallowed a Â£1, and I advised him, he wasnt prepared to do anything for me, until my wife - by now fed up with these clowns, told him we were finally fed up with the attitude of the staff in this hotel, he proceeded to tell her to calm down, she quite rightly told him his attitude stank whereon he did give me my money back. Â£1 is neither here nor there its just the overall way the staff behave here which is the matter. The hotel management need to get this sorted. The hotel bar shuts at 930pm, the breakfast is Â£7 per head extra on top of the exorbitant fee, the walls were paper thin too. I could go on. But my final comment is simply if you want somewhere to put your head down close to Victoria Station, and don't care then go to this hotel. My belief is that a 2 star hotel should do the basic things well. Be polite to your customers, as polite as they are in a 5 Star, offer clean rooms of an acceptable size, and if you offer facilities then ensure they are managed and run to offer service which makes the guests stay a pleasant one. I originally gave this two stars - I'm deducting one, reading the above, and suggest if you feel the same way I do then avoid the place. I'll finish on a final up note - want a good breakfast for half the price of the days inn? and although i didnt have it Imagine nicer - walk up to the george and dragon en route to Victoria Station, we had a really excellent breakfast in nice surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Value”
Reviews.Author: VSJEngland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the Days Inn, Westminster to celebrate the New Year. Having read some of the reviews i was a little apprehensive, however it was better than expected. a lot of the reviews stated that the rooms were very small, we must have been very lucky as we had a large room, 1 double and 2 single beds, room was very clean, bathroom was quite small but not a problem. Shower was very nice and hot which we needed as; The Major drawback to this room was the draft through the windows, appreciate the building is very old but even with the radiators on there was on constant draft, bearing in mind it was -3 degrees outside and probably not much more inside, so we had to keep layers of clothes on all the time we were in, we also had to use all of the extra blankets provided. obviously this wouldnt be issue in the summer! Breakfast was ok, continental was cereal/toast but for an extra Â£4 you could have full english! The best feature of this hotel is the location, very close to Plimico station with easy access to city. Also only Â£10 for a later check out 1pm instead of 11am. Decor is a little dated but when spending time in London you are not spending it sitting in your hotel room are you? Days Inn provides average accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “We thought this hotel was just fine!”
Reviews.Author: mpeterson
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we had some Wyndham Rewards points saved up, and we were able to redeem them for two nights at this hotel -- perfect length of time in London before we caught our train north. The location is great, near by two tube stations and lots of restaurants and pubs. Our room faced the front of the hotel with a view of Big Ben, the Parliment, and the London Eye. At night, when they were lit, the view was fabulous! We did not have any problems with street noise, however, we were right across from the lift which was semi-noisy at times. The room was an adequate size (compared to other European/British rooms) and we did have an air conditioner. I believe that you have to have the Deluxe room to have AC though. A few negatives were that the shower was positioned under an angled roof (I believe we were on the top floor) and my husband could not stand under the shower! I could barefy fit, if I turned sideways. Other than that, the room was comfortable, breakfast was adequate, and the staff was helpful and friendly. They even let us check in 5 hours early when we were totally wrecked from flying all night across the Atlantic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: smallguy
Reviews.Content: We booked this room as a reward night. We were worried about some of the comments about this place but we were very happy with our room. It was small but nice. We would stay at this Days Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: emmie174
Reviews.Content: This is about the worst place I have ever stayed in - I got a single room the size of broom cupboard with a dip in the floor that I did not want to stand on for fear of going through the floor. Did not feel safe or secure there as a single female traveller. And for Â£120 a night!! I stayed the one night and went onto a 4 star hotel which was significantly cheaper. Plus the lift stopped working numerous times when I was there. The staff were pleasant but I think they are aware of the limitations of their surroundings. Don't even think about it....

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine!”
Reviews.Author: DTJ05
Reviews.Content: If your going into this hotel expecting the hilton or the marriot think again. This hotel is clean, basic and comfortable at an affordable price for london. We booked this hotel after scouring many sub Â£60 per night hotels for a cheap weekend in london. We picked this hotel as previous reviews have said it was exactly what we were looking for. The hotel is situated on Belgrave road in the quiet suburb of Pimlico. We we're a little apprehensive at first of staying here as we had never visted this area of london before but the hotel is on a street of townhouses and other hotels. The road that the hotel is on was rather quiet, we didn't hear any traffic noise during the night whatsoever. The hotel check in was fast and the staff we're freindly, we were given a room on the 3rd floor but we had to drag our cases up the stairs as the lift was tiny and as we're all fairly fit we could walk up the stairs rather than waiting. Our room was small but had a double bed, a desk, cuboard, tv, tea and coffee making facilities and a bathroom with shower. Even though it was small it was in good working order and most importantly of all, spotlessly clean! The bathroom came with soaps, towels and you could ask reception for supplies if you forgot toothbrush, shaver etc. To be honest with you for the price we paid we we're very suprised by the room. Its not the type of room you'd want to spend a week in but for 2 nights it was perfectly fine. Besides whos going to be stuck in a room all the time in london? Not me! The hotel is not far at all from the Pimlico underground station, but due to my poor navigation skills when we arrived it took alot longer than expected to get there, when i got my bearings it was around 5 minutes away and in the area there we're 2 pubs and a few supermarkets. Overall i would say this hotel is perfect for someone looking for clean comfortable accomodation and doesnt mind a smaller room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable but small”
Reviews.Author: DozingBear
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed over a saturday night in October. We're from the UK but don't stay in London often so we don't have much to compare against within London. We stayed in a double en-suite room on the 2nd floor. It was very clean and fairly comfortable, though quite small. It had very high ceilings. The room had a balcony that looked out on to the street below and the hotel opposite. I got the room for Â£70 through an online booking site which seems expensive but judjing from other reports, is reasonable for London. I noticed the front-desk price was double that which it certainly was not worth. I had to pay a Â£10 (refundable) deposit in case I used any 'extras'. I didn't see any 'extras' in the room except for the pay-per-view movie and adult channels. The room had a hot radiator though it was still cold in the room. There was an extra blanket and pillows in the tall narrow wardrobe which made the bed very warm. On the desk was a medium sized tube TV. Other things included: kettle, iron, trouser press, hair drier. The bathroom had a powerful shower with lots of hot water, though no bath. Everything looked spotless. Liquid soap was provided,but no toothbrush or toothpaste. It's about 10-15 mins walk from Victoria station or Pimlico tube on the Victoria line. It is on Belgrave road where there are lots of hotels side-by-side on the same and neighbouring blocks leading away from Victoria station, so if you like the location you might like to check out the many other alternatives. Next to victoria station is a supermarket that opens until late. The road did have some traffic, but it was very quiet during the night and we slept well. We could hear muffled conversation from next door and clear conversation from the corridor, though it didn't go on for long. Overall we thought we would stay again here again next time we visit London.

Reviews.Title: “cheap for london and ok ish”
Reviews.Author: JaneUK
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel by price and got what I paid for. The staff were nearly civil and the room was clean. You could just about close the door once your things were in the room. I saw one other room which was not quite as small. The TV and hairdryer were temperamental. If budget is your number one factor then this is ok for what it is, but dont expect luxury!

Reviews.Title: “NOISY room!”
Reviews.Author: TempletonPeck7
Reviews.Content: Like the reviewer below, I too had a basement room (LG6) and the noise was too much for me. I got the twin room for Â£47 which is good value but was attacked by loud noise from four directions: the kitchen (which starts at 6.30am), the laundry room, the violent banging of the fire doors in the corridor and hearing every footstep from the room above. So little sleep from 6.30am onwards, not helped with the amount of light that comes through the door. The room was dark during the day (being a basement room) but spacious enough. A remote for the tv would have been nice but, noise aside, it was good value for Â£47.

Reviews.Title: “You Don't Want To Spend Too Many DAYS INN This Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Sin_Kween
Reviews.Content: I booked with Superbreak who claim this is a 3 star. I'd struggle to give it one! - The bar was closed at just after 11pm on a Saturday night - They charge extra for use of safety deposit facilities (charge is per container) - No a/c in rooms so it felt like a sauna. Open the windows by all means, but the hotel is on a busy and noisy road - Tried to charge me extra for a full breakast (even though my documentation clearly showed that my rate covered full breakfast) - Tiny bathroom. Sink is in a gap in the wall which I could only just access. This was certainly not worth the Â£88 I paid!

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: MaximoLider
Reviews.Content: Area is not bad for exploring London, close to Victoria station (5-10 mins walk). I stayed in one of the basement rooms. It was next to the kitchen, so rather loud, and had almost no daylight. Kitchen sounds from early to late. In contrast to other reviews here my room and bathroom were relatively spacious. Found it a bit basic for a three star. Room interior was not too bad but could have been a bit more friendly and could certainly use refurbishing. Overall not too bad if you can get a good deal through one of the booking sites.

Reviews.Title: “The tiniest bathroom in the world”
Reviews.Author: Meerkat19
